headline: Hasbro expects continued growth as CEO points to IP, hobby gaming
summary: Coming off the toymaker's fourth quarter earnings results, Hasbro (HAS) CEO Chris Cocks explains the continued growth that the company expects to see due to its IP (intellectual property), hobby gaming like Dungeons & Dragons and Magic: The Gathering, and toy partnerships with Disney (DIS). Also catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Chris Cocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Hasbro earnings: CEO talks results & what is driving toy demand
summary: Toymaker Hasbro (HAS) reported better-than-expected fourth quarter earnings results. Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi gets a chance to speak with Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks about the quarter, the state of the toy business, and incoming Disney CEO Josh D’Amaro. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Bath & Body Works Debuts Disney Princess Collection with New and Returning Fan-Favorite Fragrances
summary: Disney Princess Collection at Bath & Body Works The collection features new and beloved fragrances inspired by the captivating stories of six Disney Princess characters: Aurora, Belle, Mulan, Rapunzel, Snow White, and Tiana, plus Life’s a Fairytale fragrance. What You Should Know: Bath & Body Works is launching its latest Disney Princess Collection at retail locations and online on February 13, 2026, featuring new and beloved fragrances inspired by the captivating stories of six Disney Princess

headline: Is Netflix’s 10% Dip a Buying Opportunity or a Warning Sign?
summary: Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX) opened 2026 with a prediction that it would crush the S&P 500 through 2030. Six weeks later, the stock has fallen 12.32% year-to-date to $82.21, underperforming the broader market by roughly 13 percentage points. This disconnect reflects questions about whether streaming’s growth trajectory remains intact. The Bear Case: Structural Headwinds Mount Netflix’s ... Is Netflix’s 10% Dip a Buying Opportunity or a Warning Sign?
